intro: Acinodendron dodecandrum, commonly known as the twelve-branched acacia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in arid gardens.
